title: Greatest Common Divisor
description: The greatest common divisor and its properties.

ðŸ“˜ Greatest Common Divisor (GCD)

1. Definition

The greatest common divisor of two natural numbers a and b is the largest natural number that divides both a and b.

Notation: $\text{gcd}(a,b)$ or $(a,b)$

$$\text{gcd}(a,b) = \max\{d \in \mathbb{N} : d|a \text{ and } d|b\}$$

2. Properties

Commutativity

$$\text{gcd}(a,b) = \text{gcd}(b,a)$$

Associativity

$$\text{gcd}(a,\text{gcd}(b,c)) = \text{gcd}(\text{gcd}(a,b),c)$$

Divisibility Relationship

$$\text{gcd}(a,b)|a \text{ and } \text{gcd}(a,b)|b$$

3. Euclidean Algorithm

Basic Principle

For $a \geq b$:

$$\text{gcd}(a,b) = \text{gcd}(b,r)$$

where r is the remainder when a is divided by b.

Example

Calculate $\text{gcd}(48,18)$:

$$\begin{align*} 48 &= 2 \cdot 18 + 12 \\ 18 &= 1 \cdot 12 + 6 \\ 12 &= 2 \cdot 6 + 0 \end{align*}$$

Therefore $\text{gcd}(48,18) = 6$

4. Extended Euclidean Algorithm

BÃ©zout's Identity

For any natural numbers a and b, there exist integers s and t such that:

$$\text{gcd}(a,b) = sa + tb$$

Example

For $\text{gcd}(48,18)$:

$$6 = -1 \cdot 48 + 3 \cdot 18$$

5. Applications

Simplifying Fractions

A fraction $\frac{a}{b}$ can be simplified using $\text{gcd}(a,b)$:

$$\frac{a}{b} = \frac{a/\text{gcd}(a,b)}{b/\text{gcd}(a,b)}$$

Diophantine Equations

The equation $ax + by = c$ has integer solutions if and only if $\text{gcd}(a,b)|c$.

6. Related Concepts

Least Common Multiple (LCM)

$$\text{lcm}(a,b) = \frac{a \cdot b}{\text{gcd}(a,b)}$$

Coprimality

Two numbers are coprime (or relatively prime) if their gcd = 1.
